comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.204 Safari/534.16
Build Identifier: Thunderbird/3.1.9

the LDAP server at my workplace has a bind DN of the form company\username
However, everyday I am unable to connect to LDAP on the address book, because thunderbird saves it as company/username, and it gets an authentication error.
Even if i change it, when i reopen thunderbird, it is back to company/username.
I tried using \\, still the same. I ended up changing prefs.js and making it read-only.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.configure your ldap server to something in the form <company\username>
2.close thunderbird completely and open it again
3.go to address book->ldap server and see its properties
Actual Results:  
I got <company/username> in the ldap server bind dn, instead of the <company\username> i entered

Expected Results:  
find <company\username>
